metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7756 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free and use-after-scope vulnerability when logging errors from headers for XML HTTP Requests (XHR). This could result in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 54, Firefox ESR < 52.2, and Thunderbird < 52.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7756` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
